results.title: Silent Number
results.creator_credit: Jamie Blanks, Hugh Burton and Victorian College of the Arts, School of Film and Television
results.brief_description: Babysitter Nicole is subjected to a horrific night of phone calls from a guy called Matt, claiming to be beaten by his father and imprisoned in a cold place. When a bloodied man comes to the door claiming that he and his wife have been in an accident, she decides it is time to call the police. Cast includes Bronwyn Jones and John Brumpton.

results.title: Birth of a film festival
results.brief_description: Not many people know that the Melbourne International Film Festival was born at Olinda on the Australia Day weekend in January 1952, when a group of die-hard film buffs found that the only way they could see the European and Asian films they craved was to organise their own film festival. This documentary, filmed at the 50th Melbourne International Film Festival opening night, provides a fascinating glimpse of a significant event in Australian film culture through interviews, archival footage and stills.

results.title: What little girls are made of (TEFC)
results.brief_description: For over a century male scientists have been searching for evidence to demonstrate female inferiority. This program explores this idea and the effect it has had on the relationship between women and science.
results.description: For over a century male scientists have been searching for evidence to demonstrate female inferiority. This program explores this idea and the effect it has had on the relationship between women and science.

results.title: Here They Know You
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “School’s Out”.
In country towns, opportunities for school leavers are limited. Diane and Peter have left school but don’t have jobs. They reflect on the relevance of school, the sense of community in a country town and the advantages of city and country life

results.title: Solar dawn (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Kay Roberts, Gareth Cole and Solarscope Films
results.brief_description: Utilises many animation sequences to clearly show how basic solar collectors work. It shows how buildings can be heated and cooled by solar devices, and how city buildings and ordinary houses should be designed to take advantage of direct solar energy.
